title: Bug 110566: Wrong data set result returned when setting an invalid filter expression for row[0]
description: When setting a filter like "row[0] equals to 0", the data set returns the wrong result or returns a null result set.
OB: When setting an invalid filter expression for row[0] (e.g., "row[0] equals to 0"), the data set returns the wrong result or a null result set.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Set a filter in the data set using the expression "row[0] equals to 0". 
2. Click on the Preview tab.

Actual result: The first result record is returned when previewing.

Expected result: As the developer mentioned, row[0] can only be generated after all the data has been fetched. Row[0] should not be taken as a filter expression.
